# Author: Prathap A
# Date: 25/02/2025

# Entity Name :  Inspector Address

from pyspark.sql.functions import udf
from pyspark.sql.types import DateType
from datetime import datetime
from delta.tables import DeltaTable
from pyspark.sql import Window
from pyspark.sql.functions import row_number
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, TimestampType, StringType

spark.sql("""
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address (
    StaffNumber                 STRING,
    StreetandHouseNumber        STRING,
    2ndAddressLine              STRING,
    City                        STRING,
    District                    STRING,
    PostalCode                  STRING,
    RegionStateProvinceCount    STRING,
    StartDate                   DATE,
    EndDate                     DATE,   
    ChartingOfficer             STRING,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector STRING,
    SubsPSgroup                 STRING,
    TelNo                       STRING,
    PersonalMobile              STRING,
    WorkMobile                  STRING,
    Chngdon                     STRING,
    ValHashKey                  STRING
)
USING DELTA

%%sql

delete from odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

-- Insert new data into the table
INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    -- Parse StartDate in 'dd/MM/yyyy' format
    CASE 
        WHEN StartDate IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(StartDate) != '' 
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS StartDate,
    -- Parse EndDate in 'dd/MM/yyyy' format and handle '31/12/9999'
    CASE 
        WHEN EndDate IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(StartDate) != '' 
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS EndDate,
    -- Parse EndDate in 'dd/MM/yyyy' format and handle '31/12/9999' EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly;

%%sql

UPDATE odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
SET ValHashKey = md5(
    concat_ws('|',
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        --SubSSPgroup,
        TelNo,
        PersonalMobile,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon
    )
